content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1–4, find the factored form of the quadratic expression.

  1. \(3x^2+ 16x + 5\)
  • \((3x − 5)(x − 1)\)
  • \((3x + 1)(x - 5)\)
  • \((3x − 1)(x − 5)\)
  • \((3x + 1)(x + 5)\)

Answer: \((3x + 1)(x + 5)\)

  1. \(2x^2+ 11x − 6\)
  • \((2x + 6)(x − 1)\)
  • \((2x − 6)(x + 1)\)
  • \((2x − 1)(x + 6)\)
  • \((2x + 1)(x − 6)\)

Answer: \((2x − 1)(x + 6)\)

  1. \(4x^2− 13x + 3\)
  • \((4x − 1)(x − 3)\)
  • \((4x + 3)(x + 1)\)
  • \((4x − 3)(x − 1)\)
  • \((4x + 1)(x + 3)\)

Answer: \((4x − 1)(x − 3)\)

  1. \(2x^2−3x −2\)
  • \((2x + 1)(x − 2)\)
  • \((2x + 2)(x − 1)\)
  • \((2x − 2)(x + 1)\)
  • \((2x − 1)(x + 2)\)

Answer: \((2x + 1)(x − 2)\)

  1. The height, in meters, of a baseball being hit is modeled by the function \(h(x) = -2x^2+ 12x + 3\) where \(x\) is the number of seconds since being hit.

    Approximately how many seconds pass before the baseball lands on the ground? Use graphing technology if needed.
  • 4.38 seconds
  • 6.24 seconds
  • 7.26 seconds
  • 7.56 seconds

Answer: 6.24 seconds

  1. The height, in meters, of a roller coaster is modeled by the function \(h(x) = -2x^2 + 20x + 5\) where \(x\) is the number of seconds after starting.

    Approximately how many seconds pass before the roller coaster reaches the ground? Use graphing technology if needed.
  • 5.221 seconds
  • 7.963 seconds
  • 8.365 seconds
  • 10.244 seconds

Answer: 10.244 seconds

For questions 7–10, find the factored form of the quadratic expression.

  1. \(3x^2 + 2x − 5\)
  • \((3x + 5)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x + 5)(3x − 1)\)
  • \((3x + 5)(x − 1)\)
  • \((3x − 5)(x + 1)\)

Answer: \((3x + 5)(x − 1)\)

  1. \(4x^2+ 4x − 15\)
  • \((4x − 3)(x + 5)\)
  • \((2x − 3)(2x + 5)\)
  • \((4x + 3)(x − 5)\)
  • \((2x + 3)(2x − 5)\)

Answer: \((2x − 3)(2x + 5)\)

  1. \(5x^2− 39x − 8\)
  • \((5x − 1)(x + 8)\)
  • \((5x + 8)(x − 1)\)
  • \((5x − 8)(x + 1)\)
  • \((5x + 1)(x − 8)\)

Answer: \((5x + 1)(x − 8)\)

  1. \(6x^2+ 53x − 9\)
  • \((6x − 1)(x + 9)\)
  • \((3x − 1)(2x + 9)\)
  • \((2x − 1)(3x + 9)\)
  • \((6x + 1)(x − 9)\)

Answer: \((6x − 1)(x + 9)\)
